Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under the Freedom of Information Act, please could you provide the following information:
- All correspondence, including but not limited to emails, agendas, meetings and notes/minutes, which refer to the closure or temporary closure of the Shared Lives service in March 2020
- Emails written by Terry Fox, deputy leader of Sheffield Council, relating to Shared Lives befriender Kimberley Levick
- Correspondence, including but not limited to emails, agendas, meetings and notes/minutes, written to or received by Councillor Jackie Drayton relating to the Shared Lives befriender service in 2020
- How many workers were employed on a self-employed basis through the Shared Lives service as of March 2020?
- How many workers were employed through the Shared Lives service as of March 2020?
- Are there any differences in how employed and self-employed workers are paid when working for the Council's Shared Lives service? If so, please detail.
- Since Sheffield Council introduced the Shared Lived service, has the authority continued to employ people on a self-employed basis?
Yours faithfully,
Alana Roberts

Dear Alana Roberts,
Thank you for your request for information relating to correspondence
relating to the closure of the Shared Lives service which we received on
18/11/2020.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Please be aware that Sheffield City Council’s response to the global
COVID-19 pandemic has led to a reduction in resources across the Council,
meaning that we are currently dealing with a backlog of requests.
We will aim to respond to your request within 20 working days, by
16/12/2020, but we kindly ask for your patience as we anticipate that
there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not hesitate to contact us
at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Alana Roberts,
Thank you for your request for information relating to correspondence
relating to the closure of the Shared Lives service which we received on
18/11/2020.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can continue to process your FOI Request, we would like to
clarify what information you require.
For questions 4-7, you have asked “how many workers were employed on a
self-employed basis?” As employees cannot be both employed and
self-employed, please could you clarify these questions? Please can you
also clarify whether you would like information on workers or employees?
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
